info.name: Cranial nerves of Medulla
info.description: The cranial nerves associated with the medulla are the glossopharygeal (IX), vagus (X) and hypoglossal (XII).  Note that the vestibular and cochlear nuclei (VIII) are located in both the pons and medulla; as such they can be considered as part of the medulla as well.  The accessory nerve (XI) originates in the cervical spinal cord.
